2. limit personal information shared online: be careful about the information you share on social media platforms, especially when it comes to sensitive details like address, phone number, email id, etc.

3. use two-factor authentication: many social media platforms offer two-factor authentication as an added layer of security. this adds an extra step to your login process and helps prevent unauthorized access to your account.

4. beware of phishing attacks: be wary of suspicious links or messages sent by unknown individuals or entities on social media platforms. do not click on any links without verifying the source.

5. use privacy settings: most social media platforms offer privacy settings that allow you to control who can see your posts, comments, and other activities. use these settings to protect your information from being exposed to unwanted users.
